div.a: Healthy and Well Kids in Iowa program
Sign Up for L-S School Text Alerts

span.font: On April 17, 2020, Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds announced schools will be closed through the end of the school year. Based on the governor’s recommendation regarding Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19), Lynnville-Sully students will not return to classes in the school building, Online learning will continue until May 29. In addition, the school campus/building/fitness center will remain closed to all student activities until further notice. A
ll spring activities of the Iowa Girls High School Athletic Union & Iowa High School Athletic Association are cancelled.

Summer sports (boys’ baseball, girls’ softball) are suspended pending an assessment made in collaboration with state officials before June. Practice, competition, and postseason dates will be announced when they become available.

Updated information about continuous learning opportunities and school activities such as sports/performing arts, prom, graduation, etc. will be distributed to families and staff next week after receiving guidance from the Iowa Department of Education. N

p.span: ext week, the school district will provide updates on our website, social media, and via email to families and staff. If you have questions, please contact me at 641-594-4445 extension 103 or send an email:

p.font: April 14, 2020 Lynnville-Sully Closure District Newsletter. Information provided by Shane Ehresman (Superintendent) and Justine Wyma (School Nurse), click HERE

font.b: Curbside "Grab and Go" Free Student Meal
font.font: Information - Monday, April 20 & Wednesday, April 22 - Registration form closed on Sunday night at 8 pm. Next week's registration form will open on Friday.

span.font: One registration allows families to come on Monday and Wednesday to pick up meals. We strongly encourage registration so we have an accurate count, but if you miss the Sunday deadline you may still pick-up meal(s).

font.span: 0:30 am – 11:30 am: Lynnville-Sully Elementary/MS parent drive up lane

p.font: Free Food Resources Available to Students and Families - Please utilize local food resources. Volunteers work very hard to gather these food resources for local families. If open times don't work for your schedule, please call. Grinnell Heart to Heart Food Pantry - Heart of Worship Church, Lynnville, IA - Call for an appointment: 641-527-2758, 14283 Hwy F62 E, Lynnville East Jasper Christian Food Pantry - Open Saturdays from 9:00-11:30AM, (641) 594-4483, 423 2nd St. Kellogg Salvation Army of Newton - Food Pantry C - Call ahead at 641-792-6131, 301 N 2nd Ave E, Newton Mid-Iowa Community Action Food Pantry - Open Mon - Fri 8:30AM - 4:15PM (641) 236-3923, 611 4th Ave.

p.font: The Lynnville-Sully offers career and technical programs in the following service areas: Agricultural, Food, and Natural Resources; Applied Science, Technology, Engineering, and Manufacturing; Arts, Communication, and Information Systems; Business, Finance, Marketing, and Management; Health Science; Human Services
p.span: It is the policy of the Lynnville-Sully Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy, please contact the district’s Equity Coordinator, Aaron Shipley, High School Principal 12476 Hwy F62 E, Sully, Iowa 50251, 641-594-4445 extension 102, shipley@lshawks.com
